intro: Palicourea alpina var. eriantha, commonly known as the Andean moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are small berries that mature to a dark purple color. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
